constituent: length, stick, tucked under the arm
heisigStory: The length whose measure this kanji depicts extends from the tip of one hand to the tip of the other with arms at full length. Notice the final stroke, which cuts across the vertical second stroke to distinguish it from large (Frame 112).
koohiiStory1: Both a meter and a yard are about one arm-length.
koohiiStory2: This kanji reminds me of the kanji for big (I think it looks the same kinda of except for the last stroke). Maybe this works for guys, but when you were growing up you would compare "length" with your friends trying to show how BIG you were. You wouldn´t show "it" but you would spread your arms out as wide as possible to exaggerate your length. Maybe even so wide that you trip (I the 3rd stroke getting pushed over)! I just find it easier to relate this to the previous kanji.
myStory: dài. đo. cao. quẹt cánh tay
words: solid, firm, stout, burly, strong, sturdy
hero, gentleman, warrior, manly person, good health, robustness, strong, solid, durable
height, stature, length, measure, all (one has)
as much as possible, if possible
good health, robustness, strong, solid, durable, hero, gentleman, warrior, manly person
